intro: Canthium setiflorum, commonly known as the hairy flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Canthium setiflorum typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands.
